Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed black; top of rim glazed; exterior: broken maeander frieze between bands below rim; below, painted decoration consisting of part of lion's tail, to left; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Staatliche Museen zu Berlin. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

Destroyed during WW2. Illustrated in Lemos 1991 and described by A. Furtwängler, ‘Erwerbungen der Antiken sammlungen in Deutschland’, AA 1889, 85-94, esp. 93-94 no. 11. See also K.A. Neugebauer, Führer durch das Antiquarium II Vasen, Berlin 1932, p. 29-30: Inv. 3140. “Vierzehn Scherben mit Ornamenten, Resten figürlicher Darstellungen und Inschriften, teils Firnismalerei auf weißem Überzug, teils rot und weiß auf gefirnißter Fläche…. Aphroditeheiligtum zu Naukratis im Nildelta.”
Bibliographic references: Gardner 1888 / Naukratis II (p. 63, no. 728, pl. XXI, no. 728)
Bernand 1970 / Le Delta égyptien d'après les textes grecs, i: les confins libyques (p. 679, no. 379)
Cook & Woodhead 1952 / Painted Inscriptions on Chiot Pottery (p. 165 note 37)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 266, no. 595, pl. 74)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0599) (phase 2)
